docs.lead_paragraph: Veterinarians around the country are reporting a strange phenomenon: spayed dogs and cats, even some puppies and kittens, are suddenly becoming hormonal. In female pets, the symptoms resemble heat: swollen genitals, bloody discharge and behavioral problems. Male animals are showing up with swollen breast tissue and hair loss. Standard treatments and even repeated operations have had no effect.

headline.main: When Hormone Creams Expose Others to Risks

docs.lead_paragraph: Veterinarians around the country are reporting a strange phenomenon: spayed dogs and cats, even some puppies and kittens, are suddenly becoming hormonal. In female pets, the symptoms resemble heat: swollen genitals, bloody discharge and behavioral problems. Male animals are showing up with swollen breast tissue and hair loss. Standard treatments and even repeated operations have had no effect.

headline.main: When Hormone Creams Expose Others to Risks

docs.abstract: Some family members and pets are becoming inadvertently exposed to hormones through contact with women using hormone creams to counter symptoms of menopause; Food and Drug Administration has issued warnings about complications of contact with topical estrogen, but many vets and pediatricians are still unfamiliar with signs of such exposure; drawing (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: Workplace testing is drawing complaints from employees who say they should not be fired for taking legal drugs.

headline.main: Drug Testing Poses Quandary for Employers
headline.print_headline: Testing for Prescription Drugs Poses Quandary for Employers

docs.snippet: Workplace testing is drawing complaints from employees who say they should not be fired for taking legal drugs.

byline.original: By KATIE ZEZIMA and ABBY GOODNOUGH

docs.lead_paragraph: The war on drugs has become focused on marijuana, is being waged primarily against minorities and is being promoted by Democratic politicians.
docs.snippet: The war on drugs has become focused on marijuana, is being waged primarily against minorities and is being promoted by Democratic politicians.

docs.lead_paragraph: Updated: Eli Lilly & Company, confronted with research setbacks and pending patent losses, reported a quarterly profit on Thursday that beat Wall Street estimates. It also raised its forecast for full-year 2010 profits, saying one reason was that the health care overhaul passed by Congress was costing it less than expected.

headline.main: Lilly Beats Estimates and Raises Full-Year Forecast

docs.abstract: Eli Lilly & Co reports third-quarter profit of $1.3 billion, or $1.18 per share, up 38 percent from year-ago quarter; revenue was $5.65 billion; photo (M)
